subclusters.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Lipid Peroxidation Theory
Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Lipid Peroxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on caloric restriction effects on lifespan via modulation of lipid peroxidation and oxidative damage, emphasizing genotype-environment interactions and lipid oxidative products.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Lipid Peroxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes how caloric restriction reduces mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage, linking CR to lifespan extension through modulation of oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Lipid Peroxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses oxidative stress as a driver of aging and how antioxidant enzymes modulate damage, with emphasis on caloric restriction reducing oxidative damage and extending lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Lipid Peroxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on caloric restriction slowing aging by reducing oxidative damage and enhancing antioxidant defenses and repair mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Lipid Peroxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitohormesis triggered by calorie restriction mimetics and triglyceride depletion, activating sirtuin pathways and antioxidant defenses to promote longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Lipid Peroxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains mitohormesis induced by caloric restriction mimetics that increase mitochondrial ROS signaling to enhance antioxidant defenses and autophagy, promoting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Caloric Restriction and Lipid Peroxidation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on lipid peroxidation biomarkers and antioxidant vitamin E deficiency accelerating aging phenotypes, linking oxidative damage to functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes a genetic regulatory network (oxy-regulon) controlling antioxidant enzyme expression that determines lifespan by modulating oxidative stress defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes extracellular superoxide dismutase (ecSOD) as a key antioxidant enzyme whose decline with age causes oxidative stress and endothelial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights the role of mitochondrial ROS and antioxidant enzymes like Cu,ZnSOD in skeletal muscle aging, linking enzyme activity to oxidative damage and functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on imbalance of antioxidant enzymes (SOD1/Gpx1 ratio) leading to hydrogen peroxide accumulation and cellular senescence, implicating enzyme regulation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS production and antioxidant enzyme scavenging balance in fungal aging models, linking enzyme activity to lifespan modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses evolution and coordination of antioxidant defense mechanisms, highlighting genetic and metabolic adaptations influencing oxidative stress resistance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS accumulation and antioxidant defense inefficiency in yeast chronological aging, linking enzyme activity and stress resistance to lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS imbalance, and mtDNA damage in aging, emphasizing antioxidant defense decline and genetic factors in oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details ROS production, antioxidant defenses, and systemic oxidative damage accumulation in aging males, highlighting enzymatic and non-enzymatic antioxidants.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genetic Regulation of Antioxidant Enzymes Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS damage accumulation and metallothionein antioxidant regulation via genetic pathways, linking gene expression control to oxidative stress and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative stress causing DNA damage and antioxidant depletion leading to cellular senescence, particularly in human peritoneal mesothelial cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress-driven premature immunosenescence via ROS-induced DNA damage, telomere shortening, and inflammatory feedback loops in T cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress accelerating telomere shortening and dysfunction, linking ROS damage to cellular senescence and biological aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress causing premature loss of meiotic cohesion in oocytes, leading to chromosome segregation errors and reproductive aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative DNA damage to PARP hyperactivation causing NAD+ depletion, impairing energy metabolism and sirtuin activity, accelerating cellular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights ROS-induced cellular damage and apoptosis mediated by p66shc, linking oxidative stress signaling to aging and degenerative diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on region-specific oxidative protein damage in brain causing cognitive and motor decline, linking oxidative stress to functional senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tissue Peroxidation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes that tissue-specific peroxidation potential and antioxidant defenses determine species longevity, emphasizing biochemical tissue properties in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tissue Peroxidation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links accumulation of protein oxidative damage and insufficient repair to physiological aging rate and life expectancy, focusing on protein carbonyls as biomarkers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tissue Peroxidation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative DNA and protein damage accumulation influenced by metabolic rate, correlating damage levels with life expectancy in houseflies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tissue Peroxidation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative damage mitigation in social insects linked to caste longevity, highlighting enhanced oxidation-reduction gene expression and reproductive status.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tissue Peroxidation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes urate as a major endogenous antioxidant influencing longevity by scavenging oxygen radicals, linking antioxidant concentration per metabolic rate to lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tissue Peroxidation and Longevity Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Presents computational models of ROS production, signaling, and scavenging, emphasizing mitochondrial ROS bistability and redox balance in aging.
